column26: Description
column79: Custom field ([CHART] Date of First Response)

column1: Review proposed PR for alert ingestion

column26:
* As a Product Owner
* I want a short period of focused support after go-live (4 weeks)
* So that any early issues are quickly resolved.
* Acceptance criteria
** 28-day post-deployment support window defined (matching work package).
** Process for raising/triaging production issues agreed.

* As a platform engineer
* I want CI/CD updated for the new module
* So that deployments to dev and prod are consistent.
* Acceptance criteria
** Build includes Case Management UI and API services.
** DB migrations run as part of deployment.

column1: Regression testing of existing FRP functionality
column26:
* As a system owner
* I want assurance that existing features still work
* So that introducing Case Management does not break the portal.
* Acceptance criteria
** Regression pack identified for critical FRP flows.
** Pack executed in staging before release.
** Any regressions raised and fixed before go-live.

* As a Product Owner
* I want structured UAT sessions
* So that the feature is validated by real users.
* Acceptance criteria
** UAT plan prepared covering IDs 1–4 from work package.
** Feedback captured, triaged into defects vs change requests.
** Up to 2 iterations of agreed in-scope changes delivered.

* As a dev team
* We want automated tests
* So that we can catch regressions early.
* Acceptance criteria
** Unit tests for services.
** API tests for main endpoints (incl. permissions).
** UI tests for core flows: filter, create, edit, close case.

column1: Implement “Boost Pressure Tracker”, “Air Leaks”, “Coolant Temperature” panels
column26:
* As a reliability engineer
* I want key diagnostic charts for the selected filters
* So that I can quickly see patterns linked to cases.
* Acceptance criteria
** Three panels implemented per mock-up (even if initially simple charts).
** Panels query Databricks for aggregated metrics for filtered fleet + subsystem.
** Empty states when data is unavailable.

column1: Visual state & accessibility for train filter (if budget allows)
column26:
{color:#ff5630}THIS CARD SHOULD ONLY BE ACTIONED IF THERE IS BUDGET REMAINING{color}

* As a user with accessibility needs
* I want the train filter to be keyboard-navigable and understandable
* So that I can use it without a mouse and with assistive tech.
* Acceptance criteria
** Focus states, ARIA labels and tooltips for each subsystem.
** Keyboard navigation cycles hotspots.
** Works alongside traditional dropdown for subsystem so the feature is not “image-only”.

* As a user
* I want clicking a subsystem to filter the grid and dashboards
* So that I see only cases relevant to that subsystem.
* Acceptance criteria
** Clicking a hotspot sets the subsystem filter and UI shows which subsystem is active.
** Deselection behaviour defined (e.g. click again to clear).
** Integration tests verify correct query params when different subsystems selected.

!image-20260107-084801.png|width=694,alt="image-20260107-084801.png"!

* As a user
* I want to click on parts of a train image
* So that I can filter cases by subsystem visually.
* Acceptance criteria
** SVG (or vector) train image created with defined hotspot regions (e.g. engine, HVAC, doors, UAT, brakes, bogies) based on concept design.
** Subsystem taxonomy agreed and mapped to each hotspot.
** Responsive design tested on common resolutions.

!image-20260107-084702.png|width=694,alt="image-20260107-084702.png"!

* As a user
* I want to create a new case even when there’s no alert
* So that I can log ad-hoc investigations.
* Acceptance criteria
** “Create case” button on page.
** Form includes mandatory fields: title, vehicle/unit, subsystem, description; optional: alert/WO/incident links.
** On success, user is taken to the new case detail.

!Screenshot 2026-01-07 090128-20260107-090129.png|width=312,alt="Screenshot 2026-01-07 090128-20260107-090129.png"!

* As a user
* I want to view a full case record and update it
* So that I can manage investigations.
* Acceptance criteria
** Detail view shows: core metadata, linked alerts/WOs/incidents, signal panels, notes, documents.
** Edit mode with form validation.
** Status change (e.g. Open → In Progress → Completed) with confirmation.

!image-20260107-090318.png|width=688,alt="image-20260107-090318.png"!

* As a user
* I want a table of cases with key attributes and drill-down
* So that I can review and update cases efficiently.
* Acceptance criteria
** Grid displays columns similar to concept (ID, fleet/unit/vehicle, title, description, status, meeting notes/updates, dates, subsystem).
** Pagination and sorting by key columns.
** Clicking a row opens a case detail drawer.
** Supports inline search by case ID/title.

!image-20260107-090008.png|width=632,alt="image-20260107-090008.png"!

* As a user
* I want to see counts of total, new and completed reports
* So that I understand workload at a glance.
* Acceptance criteria
** KPI tiles display counts consistent with grid filters.
** “New” and “Completed” defined and documented (e.g. last 7 days, status enums).
** Loading and error states handled.

!image-20260107-083932.png|width=694,alt="image-20260107-083932.png"!

* As a user
* I want to filter cases by TOC, class, depot, unit, vehicle, period and date
* So that I can focus on relevant cases.
* Acceptance criteria
** Filter controls for: TOC, Class, Depot, Unit, Vehicle, Period, Date range (per mock-up).
** Changing filters refreshes counters, train image highlighting, dashboards and grid.
** Filters URL-encoded so views can be bookmarked/shared.

!image-20260107-085757.png|width=694,alt="image-20260107-085757.png"!
column81:
07/Jan/26 8:59 AM;712020:938e247f-27ba-4c56-aa72-d04f4aa4f9ba;[NOTE] Currently, the implemented filters are TOC, Class, Depot and Unit. Vehicle and Period/Date are missing.

!image-20260107-085842.png|width=602,alt="image-20260107-085842.png"!

column26:
* As a user
* I want a Case Management option in the portal nav
* So that I can access the feature from the existing FRP.
* Acceptance criteria
** New menu item “Case Management” (or agreed label) in left nav.
** Page is routed within existing React app and respects auth/permissions.

column1: Integration with maintenance work orders & incidents
column26:
* As a fleet engineer
* I want to see related unplanned WOs and incidents in a case
* So that I can understand past actions and performance.
* Acceptance criteria
** API service that, given vehicle and time window, returns related WOs and incidents.
** Case stores references to associated WOs/incidents.
** Exposed via API for the UI.

!image-20260107-085712.png|width=323,alt="image-20260107-085712.png"!

* As a reliability engineer
* I want RCM alerts to pre-fill case context
* So that I don’t have to manually enter details.
* Acceptance criteria
** API that, given an alert ID, returns: timeseries snippet(s), vehicle, timestamps, relevant KPIs.
** Case creation endpoint accepts an alert ID and stores linkage.
** At least one alert type integrated end-to-end.

column1: Attach signals, notes and documents to a case
column26:
* As a fleet engineer
* I want to attach time-series signals, comments and documents to a case
* So that everything relevant is stored together.
* Acceptance criteria
** Endpoints to create/read notes and documents for a case.
** Signals endpoint that stores references to Databricks extracted time-series.
** Max attachment size / supported types defined.

* As a frontend developer
* I want REST endpoints to create, read, update and close cases
* So that the UI can manage case lifecycle.
* Acceptance criteria
** Endpoints created e.g. {{GET /cases}}*,* {{GET /cases/{id}}}*,* {{POST /cases}}*,* {{PUT /cases/{id}}}*,* {{PATCH /cases/{id}/status}}*.*
** Supports filters: TOC, class, depot, unit, vehicle, date range, status, subsystem.
** Validation rules enforced (required fields, max lengths, valid statuses).
** API documentation (OpenAPI/Swagger) updated.
column81:
07/Jan/26 8:53 AM;712020:938e247f-27ba-4c56-aa72-d04f4aa4f9ba;[NOTE] The implemented endpoints don't quite match the request methods defined in this card

!image-20260107-085329.png|width=634,alt="image-20260107-085329.png"!
column82: 07/Jan/26 8:56 AM;712020:938e247f-27ba-4c56-aa72-d04f4aa4f9ba;[NOTE] These endpoints are currently utilising mock data and will need to be repointed to query the SQL DB tables

column1: Define mirroring from Databricks entities to cases DB
column26:
* As a case investigator
* I want each case to reference relevant alert context, WOs and incidents
* So that I can see the full context.
* Acceptance criteria
** Data model includes stable IDs/keys
** Mapping rules between FRP DB and warehouse documented (e.g. via vehicle ID, timestamp ranges, etc.).
** Sample mappings tested for at least one fleet and tests prove functionality
column81: 07/Jan/26 8:01 AM;712020:938e247f-27ba-4c56-aa72-d04f4aa4f9ba;17/12/25 RakeHistory and UnifiedInterventions mirrored over to SQL DB
column82: 07/Jan/26 8:01 AM;712020:938e247f-27ba-4c56-aa72-d04f4aa4f9ba;07/01/2026 Depot field added to RakeHistory (mirrored table only) and RCMCaseManagement table mirrored over to SQL DB
column83:
07/Jan/26 8:02 AM;712020:938e247f-27ba-4c56-aa72-d04f4aa4f9ba;+Remaining Tasks+

* Core notebooks Dev → Main
* Terraform the task to mirror RCMCaseManagement over to SQL DB

column1: Implement case tables in FRP SQL Server
column26:
* As a platform engineer
* I want the new schema deployed -via migrations-
* So that environments stay consistent.
* Acceptance criteria
** Migration scripts created and applied to dev DB.
** Primary keys, FKs, indexes created.
column81:
07/Jan/26 7:59 AM;712020:938e247f-27ba-4c56-aa72-d04f4aa4f9ba;+Remaining Tasks+

* Write all CREATE TABLE statements for case tables
* Write all stored procedures for case tables
* Create notebook task to add to the ingest_rcm_case_management_job_000 to populate case tables

column26:
* As a data engineer
* I want a normalised schema for cases and related data
* So that case data is consistent, queryable and performant.
* Acceptance criteria
** Tables defined (e.g. {{Case}}*,* {{CaseSignal}}*,* {{CaseNote}}*,* {{CaseDocument}}*,* {{CaseLink}} to alerts/WOs/incidents, subsystem lookup).
** Relationships clearly defined.
** ERD/schema diagram produced and stored in Confluence.

column1: Finalise UX for Case Management page
column26:
* As a fleet engineer
* I want a clear, intuitive Case Management page
* So that I can quickly see open cases, drill down and create new ones.
* Acceptance criteria
** Wireframes in Figma updated from the conceptual design (filters row, KPI tiles, train graphic, three signal panels, cases grid).
** States defined: loading, empty, no permissions, error.
** UX reviewed and signed off by Porterbrook.

column1: Confirm functional scope of Case Management
column26:
* As a Product Owner
* I want a shared understanding of core case workflows and data sources
* So that the team can design a solution aligned with Porterbrook’s needs.
* Acceptance criteria
** Documented workflows for: create case, update, close, search/filter, export/print.
** Data sources confirmed: Databricks tables (RCM alerts, sensor data, unplanned WOs, incidents) + existing FRP DB.
** Tables to be mirrored to SQL DB.
** Agreement on minimum viable feature set and “stretch” items (e.g. Teams digest, repeat-flagging) that can be extended for later use.
column81: 24/Nov/25 10:57 AM;5fbff729facfd60076fd4484;Porterbrook have asked for RCM signal viewing capability and understand this is a change request. THis should be proposed under the AssetBeats model as a freebie, or under a seperate VO at 5 days non-discounted effort.
